00048 client :: client () : tcpip ()
00049 {
00050   recived = NULL;
00051 }
00052 
00053 client :: ~client ()
00054 {
00055   if (recived != NULL)
00056     delete recived;
00057 }

00060 void client :: send (char* host, char* service, char* packet)
00061 {
00062   int sock;
00063   sock = connectUDP (host, service);
00064   (void) write (sock, packet, strlen (packet));
00065   close (sock);
00066 }
00067 
00068 bool client :: recive (char* host, char* service, char* packet)
00069 {
00070   char buff[2048];
00071   buff[1] = '\0';
00072   int sock;
00073   int length;
00074   sock = connectUDP (host, service);
00075   write (sock, packet, strlen (packet));
00076 /*
00077   fd_set rfds;
00078   struct timeval tv;
00079   tv.tv_sec = 3;
00080   tv.tv_usec = 0;
00081   FD_ZERO (&rfds);
00082   FD_SET (sock, &rfds);
00083   int a = select (1, &rfds, NULL, NULL, &tv);
00084   if (a == 0)
00085     {
00086       cerr << _NET_ERR_ << "read failed: Socket Timeout\n";
00087       return false;
00088     }
00089   if (a < 0)
00090     {
00091       cerr << _NET_ERR_ << "select failed: " << sys_errlist [errno] << "\n";
00092       return false;
00093     }
00094 */
00095   length = read (sock, buff, sizeof (buff));
00096   close (sock);
00097   if (length < 0)
00098     {
00099       cerr << _NET_ERR_ << "read failed: " << sys_errlist [errno] << "\n";
00100       return false;
00101     }
00102   buff[length] = '\0';
00103   if (recived != NULL)
00104     delete recived;
00105   recived = NULL;
00106   recived = new char [length+1];
00107   assert (recived != NULL);
00108   strcpy (recived, buff);
00109   return true;
00110 }
00111 
00112 char* client :: get_recived ()
00113 {
00114   return recived;
00115 }
